question: Matt has a flower stand at the community market. He sells three kinds of flowers: lilies, orchids and daisies. He usually sells lilies for $1.9085714285714284 per bunch, orchids for $5.53 per bunch and daisies for $5.522 per bunch. Matt has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Matt sells 14 bunchs of lilies, 30 bunchs of orchids and 38 bunchs of daisies, how much will he make?
answer:
Matt will round his lilies up from $1.9085714285714284 to $2, since the number following the 1 is 5 or higher.
Matt will round his orchids up from $5.53 to $6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Matt will round his daisies up from $5.522 to $6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Matt sells 14 lilies*$2 = $<<14*2=28>>28
Matt sells 30 orchids*$6 = $<<30*6=180>>180
Matt sells 38 daisies*$6 = $<<38*6=228>>228
Altogether, Matt will make $28 + $180 + $228 = $<<28+180+228=436>>436
#### 436
